folder: Plumb 1st Street & Voorhies Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Plumb 1st Street (foreground) south of Voorhies Ave., looking southeast, showing Gerritsen Beach at left. On the right is a foot bridge, which connects Plumb Island with Sheepshead Bay.
July 4, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Voorhies Ave. & Plumb 1st St., Brooklyn, NY
text:
Voorhies Ave., east from Plumb 1st Street to Shell Bank Creek where it terminates. In the background are the Gerritsen Beach homes. At the left is Plumb 1st Street.
July 7, 1935.
P.L. Sperr.

(1) Plumb Island, at about Plumb 1st Street and Voorhies Ave., viewed northeastward, showing Gerritsen Beach beyond Plumb Beach Channel. July 4, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same area, looking northeast, showing Gerritsen Beach (left) beyond Plumb Beach Channel. This view shows a view farther west than in No. 1. July 4, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, looking northward, showing Gerritsen Beach in the background. July 4, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Plumb Island - [Gerritsen beach - Plumb Beach Channel.]

text:

folder: Voorhies Ave. & Plumb 1st St., Brooklyn, NY
text:
Voorhies Ave. at the N.E. corner of Plumb 1st Street, as seen from Shell Bank Creek, showing "Roeders Corals", which is a dining, drinking and dancing establishment.

June 18, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
